riddle: I was born in a dorm room in 2004. I connect billions of people but I'm not a phone company. Mark is my creator. What am I?
I'm a verb and a noun. People use me billions of times a day to find answers. My name was inspired by a very large number. What am I?
I'm a fruit, but you can't eat me. I make phones, computers, and watches. My logo had a bite taken out of it. What company am I?
I live in the cloud and keep your files safe. My name is a container where you store things. Google made me. What am I?
I was bought by Google in 2006. Every minute, 500 hours of content are uploaded to me. You can watch anything from cats to courses. What am I?
I have an inbox but I'm not a mailbox. I have spam but I'm not a grocery store. I have drafts but I'm not a writer's desk. What am I?
I help teams talk face-to-face without being in the same place. I have a mute button that saves embarrassing moments. You're probably using me right now! What am I?
I started by selling books, now I sell everything. My name is also a famous rainforest. Prime is my special membership. What company am I?
I'm a combination of letters, numbers, and symbols. I protect your accounts but you always forget me. You probably have too many of me. What am I?
I pop up on your screen to tell you something new. I can be helpful or annoying. You can turn me off in settings. What am I?
I connect your devices without any wires. I'm in coffee shops, homes, and airports. You always ask for my password when you visit someone. What am I?
I'm a social network for your career, not your personal life. I have a blue logo and help people find jobs. Recruiters love me. What am I?
I live under your hand and help you navigate your screen. I have left and right buttons, and sometimes a wheel in the middle. What am I?
I'm a small digital image or icon used to express an idea or emotion. I can be happy, sad, or even a pizza. What am I?
I started by mailing DVDs, now I stream shows and movies. 'N' is my first letter. Binge-watching was practically invented because of me. What am I?
I'm an appearance setting that makes your screen darker. I save battery and help your eyes at night. What mode am I?
When content spreads rapidly online, it's said to go _____. It's named after something that makes you sick. What word am I?
I'm limited to 280 characters (used to be 140). I have hashtags and retweets. My logo is a blue bird. What am I?
I temporarily store what you copy. I hold your text or images until you paste them somewhere else. What am I?
When a webpage isn't loading right, you press me. I make things load again from the start. I'm often an arrow in a circle. What am I?
I'm a platform where developers share code. My logo is an octocat. Microsoft bought me for $7.5 billion. What am I?
I'm a cryptocurrency that started in 2009. My creator is anonymous, known only by a pseudonym. People call me digital gold. What am I?
I'm a photo-sharing app known for square photos and filters. Facebook bought me for $1 billion. My logo is a camera. What am I?
I'm an AI assistant that lives in your phone. I can answer questions, set reminders, and tell jokes. My name sounds like a fruit. What am I?
I'm a website where developers can save and share code snippets. My name suggests a location for temporary storage. What am I?
I'm Google's core search algorithm update from 2019. My name suggests I'm broad and comprehensive. I changed how websites rank in search results. What am I?
I'm a programming language created by Guido van Rossum. My name comes from a comedy group. I'm known for my simple syntax. What am I?
I'm Amazon's cloud computing platform. My name suggests I have a front and back. I power Netflix, Reddit, and Twitter. What am I?
I'm a distributed version control system created by Linus Torvalds. My name is British slang for 'stupid' or 'unpleasant'. What am I?
I'm a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine. My logo is green and hexagonal. I enable server-side JavaScript. What am I?
